question_text: What display hardware components should you check during video troubleshooting?
answer_options: Only the monitor screen itself without considering other components
Graphics card, monitor, cables, power supplies, motherboard video outputs, adapters
Display hardware problems are always software-related issues
Only internal components without considering external display connections
correct_answer: Graphics card, monitor, cables, power supplies, motherboard video outputs, adapters
explanation: Display hardware includes: graphics card (dedicated or integrated), monitor, video cables (VGA, DVI, HDMI, DisplayPort), power supplies (for both PC and monitor), motherboard video outputs, port adapters, and cable converters. Systematic testing of each component helps isolate hardware failures from software issues.
